Time and Place: The meeting is scheduled to start at 1400 on Thursday May 13th, at the Royal Academy of Dutch language and Literature, 18 Koningstraat, Gent, and concluding at 1800. Friday we'll meet again, starting at 0900, at the same location, and concluding at 1800. If necessary, the meeting will continue on Saturday. Logistical information is available at the website
Timings below are highly provisional guesstimates...

list.item: Review of the agenda for the meeting, and any outstanding items from the council's last call () not covered elsewhere. (15 mins)
Migration Workgroup Report. (). Alex Bia and Susan Schreibman to summarize recommendations and any outstanding issues for Council review. (30 mins)
Proposed new Workgroup on Physical Bibliography. (See ). Julia Flanders to present charge and workplan for Council review. (30 mins)
Current state of P5. The editors will briefly summarize the current state of affairs: see (15 mins)
Maintenance and development using Sourceforge; associated licensing issues. (Sebastian to outline technical issues. Council to review its earlier recommendation to Board) (30 mins)
Report from "OpenSP for Windows" project (see . (5 mins)
Report from Sanskrit word-end workgroup tabled by John Smith ( (15 mins)
Outputs from the MetaLanguage Task Force Report (. Sebastian Rahtz/Editors to present content of new ODD system and any outstanding unresolved issues. (90 mins)
Internationalization and interoperability. Sebastian Rahtz/Alejandro Bia to present work on I18N facilities in P5. (20 mins)

Character Encoding Workgroup outputs. ( and ). Christian Wittern to present content of the new draft chapters, and summarize any outstanding issues. Council to discuss, and determine whether these are now ready for publication. (45 mins)

Draft from the joint ISO-TEI Activity on Feature Structures. (). Laurent Romary to summarize formal status of draft within ISO, proposed changes to P4 recommendations, and any outstanding unresolved issues. Council to determine whether draft is ready for inclusion in P5. (30 mins)
Manuscript Description Taskforce outputs. (). Matthew Driscoll to present intended changes to content of the draft chapter, and summarize any outstanding issues, for review by Council. (30 mins)
Outputs from Standoff workgroup. (). David Durand to present proposed changes to P4 recommendations on linking, and summarize any outstanding issues, for review by Council. (30 mins)
Timetable for P5 publication. Council to assess current published plans at and agree revisions. (60 mins)
If other items are added to the agenda, or if we fall behind the schedule proposed above, we may meet from 9-noon on Saturday.
